description:
No bad apples here

Grow your own crisp apples even in the smallest yard with this uniquely slim tree.

Unlike traditional spreading apple trees, Scarlet Sentinel grows straight up like a pillar, needing just 2-3 feet of space—perfect for patios and tight spaces. Its narrow shape means easy maintenance, and the convenient height keeps fruit within reach. Plant with a companion apple tree like Fuji or Honeycrisp nearby for the best harvest.

sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Yard Advisors:
How do I store bare root trees before planting?
Plant within 24 hours of delivery. If needed, store briefly in a cool, dark place with roots wrapped in moist (not wet) newspaper. Learn more on how to care for new bare root plants (https://www.getsunday.com/shed/garden/how-to-care-for-new-bare-root-plants)
What size will my tree be at planting?
Your bare root tree arrives at 9/16" caliper (trunk diameter), ready for planting.
What growing zone do I need?
For best results, plant in zones 4-8.
How long until my tree produces fruit?
Trees typically begin producing fruit in 2-3 years, with full harvests by year 4-5.
Do I need another apple tree nearby?
Yes, plant a compatible variety like Fuji or Honeycrisp within 50 feet for pollination.
